get.summary: Get a model group by ID
get.description: Endpoint for retriving model groups

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Accept-Language header with ISO 639-1 language code

_Default: en_

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: UUID of model group, 'root' for the root model group

parameters.name: icon
parameters.description: If flag is set to true the icon of the artefact is returned

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description:
If flag is set to true the whole tree, beginning from the model group which id was specified as group-id, is
returned, including artefacts and specified attributes

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: Response will have the specified attribute inside, unless, the attribute has no value

200.description: JSON document consisting of id, name, list of contained groups (id and name), list of contained objects (id, class, name)

401.description: (Unauthorized Access) Your request lacks valid authentication credentials

403.description: (Forbidden) You don't have access to that action

404.description: (Not found) The passed group does not exist

500.description: (Internal Server Error) An unexpected server issue was encountered

get.summary: Gets a model by ID
get.description:
Can be used for:
* **Retrieving model properties**
* **Retrieving model image**

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Accept-Language header with ISO 639-1 language code

_Default: en_

parameters.name: dpi
parameters.description:
Defines the DPIs in which the image is generated. 300 by default. This parameter is relevant for header:
```
Accept: image/png
```
Cached DPIs: 
* 300
* 150
* 72 

Images for any other value are generated at runtime.

_Note: DPI should not be smaller or equal to zero._

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description:
Defines the attribute of the resource that may be returned in result. There can be many of them within a one request URL. If no attribute parameter is defined then all attributes of resource are returned. e.g:
```
&attribute=CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE&attribute=A_DESCRIPTION
```

parameters.name: relation
parameters.description:
Defines the relation of the resource that may be returned in result. There can be many of them within a one request URL. If no relation parameter is defined then all relations of resource are returned. e.g:
```
&relation=CUSTOM_RELATION&relation=RC_MANAGER
```

parameters.name: embeddedFonts
parameters.description:
Defines whether fonts should be embedded or not. This parameter is relevant for header:
```
Accept: image/svg+xml
```
_Default: false_

parameters.name: showAll
parameters.description:
If set to true returns all attributes and relations else only these visible in notebook. 

_Default: false_

parameters.name: richText
parameters.description:
If set to true returns attribute value as rich text.

_Default: false_

200.description:
* JSON or XML document consisting of id, type, name, list of properties (name, value), list of objects (id, class, name).
* PNG image if the request header Accept had the value image/png
* SVG image if the request header  Accept  had the value  image/svg+xml

get.summary: Execute search queries
get.description:
_List of search operators_
|Operator|Filters object (examples)|
|:------|:------|
|Empty Operator (OP_EMPTY)|{attrName: "A_DESCRIPTION ", op: “OP_EMPTY”}|
|NoEmpty Operator (OP_NEMPTY)|{attrName:"A_DESCRIPTION", op:“OP_NEMPTY”}|
|Like Operator (OP_LIKE)|{attrName: "A_DESCRIPTION ",value: "string" OR ["string1", "string2"],op: “OP_LIKE”}|
|Not Like Operator (OP_NLIKE)|{attrName: "A_DESCRIPTION ",value: "string",op: “OP_NLIKE”}|
|Equal (OP_EQ)|{attrName:"A_NEED_FOR_ACTION",value:true,op:“OP_EQ”}|
|NoEqual (OP_NEQ)|{attrName: "A_NEED_FOR_ACTION ",value: true,op: “OP_NEQ”}|
|Greater (OP_GR)|{attrName: "A_VALUE_AT_RISK ",value: 2,op: “OP_GR”}|
|Greater or equal (OP_GR_EQ)|{attrName: "A_DESCRIPTION",value: "description",op: “OP_GR_EQ”}|
|Less (OP_LE)|{attrName: "A_VALUE_AT_RISK ",value: 2,op: “OP_LE”}|
|Less or equal (OP_LE_EQ)|{attrName: "A_DESCRIPTION",value: "description",op: “OP_LE_EQ”}|
|Regex Operator (OP_REGEX)|{attrName: "A_DESCRIPTION",value: "^this is .*e$",op: “OP_REGEX”}|
|Range Operator (OP_RANGE)|{attrName: "A_VALUE_AT_RISK",values: [1,3],op: “OP_RANGE”}|
|Not Range Operator (OP_NRANGE)|{attrName: "A_VALUE_AT_RISK",values: [1,3],op: “OP_NRANGE”}|
|Contains Any Operator (OP_CONTAINS_ANY)|{attrName:"APP",values:["v0", "v1", "v2"], op: “OP_CONTAINS_ANY”}|

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Accept-Language header with ISO 639-1 language code

_Default: en_

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
The search term that is used to perform the search. This parameter is passed as a JSON object called “filters” which is of type array. Each object on the array is a separate filter in terms of ado.query API.
e.g
```
?query=%7B"filters":%5B%7BclassName: %5B"C_TASK", "C_ACTOR"%5D%7D,%7BattrName: "A_DESCRIPTION", value: "This is a description", op: "OP_EQ"%7D%5D%7D
```
**Have in mind that: '[]' characters needs to be replaced with %5B and %5D; '{}' characters needs to be replaced with %7B and %7D**

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description:
Defines the attribute of the resource that may be returned in result. There can be many of them within a one request URL. If no attribute parameter is defined then all attributes of resource are returned. e.g:
```
&attribute=CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE&attribute=A_DESCRIPTION
```

parameters.name: range-start
parameters.description:
Defines the start of the range of results to be fetched from the total result.

_Default: 0_

parameters.name: range-end
parameters.description:
Defines the end of the range of results to be fetched from the total result. A default value is not configurable yet. -1 denotes all results.

_Default: 1000_

parameters.name: groupByRec
parameters.description: For fetching groupped/non-groupped result (only with "text/csv" header!)

parameters.name: separator
parameters.description:
To choose character that will separate data (';' - semicolon value or ',' - comma value) (only with "text/csv" header!) e.g:
```
&separator=comma
```
```
&separator=semicolon
```

200.description: JSON or XML object or CSV string with properties representing metadata of the response (number of total hits, etc.) and nonnull array with result items. Each result item should in turn contain its meta data and a nonnull array with its properties.

403.description: (Forbidden) You don't have access to that action

404.description: (Not Found) The passed id is not found

500.description: (Internal Server Error) An unexpected server issue was encountered

infotext.en:
Enter the title of the seminar (course) for further education of the employees in the column "Seminar title".

The column "Participated in" contains the time of the participation in the format MM.YYYY, i.e. month and year of participation in the seminar/course (e.g. 02.2002 for a course made in February 2002).

aDataValue.en:
A Sub-Process is an Activity whose internal details have been modeled using Activities, Gateways, Events, and Sequence Flows. A Sub-Process is a graphical object within a Process, but it also can be “opened up” to show a lower-level Process. Sub-Processes define a contextual scope that can be used for attribute visibility, transactional scope, for the handling of exceptions, of Events, or for compensation. There are different types of Sub-Processes:

Embedded Sub-Process (Sub-Process):
A Sub-Process object shares the same shape as the Task object, which is a rounded rectangle. 
A Sub-Process is a rounded corner rectangle that MUST be drawn with a single thin line. 
The use of text, color, size, and lines for a Sub-Process MUST follow the rules defined in Section “Use of Text, Color, Size, and Lines in a Diagram” with the exception that: 
A boundary drawn with a thick line SHALL be reserved for Call Activity (Sub-Processes).
A boundary drawn with a dotted line SHALL be reserved for Event Sub-Processes. 
A boundary drawn with a double line SHALL be reserved for Transaction.

Sub-Processes: 
The Sub-Process can be in a collapsed view that hides its details or a Sub-Process can be in an expanded view that shows its details within the view of the Process in which it is contained. In the collapsed form, the Sub-Process object uses a marker to distinguish it as a Sub-Process, rather than a Task. 
The Sub-Process marker MUST be a small square with a plus sign (+) inside. The square MUST be positioned at the bottom center of the shape.
BPMN specifies five types of standard markers for Sub-Processes. The (Collapsed) Sub-Process marker, can be combined with four other markers: a loop marker or a multi-instance marker, a Compensation marker, and an Ad-Hoc marker. A collapsed Sub-Process MAY have one to three of these other markers, in all combinations except that loop and multi-instance cannot be shown at the same time. 
The marker for a Sub-Process that loops MUST be a small line with an arrowhead that curls back upon itself. 
The loop marker MAY be used in combination with any of the other markers except the multi-instance marker. 
The marker for a Sub-Process that has multiple instances MUST be a set of three vertical lines in parallel. 
The multi-instance marker MAY be used in combination with any of the other markers except the loop marker. 
The marker for an ad-hoc Sub-Process MUST be a “tilde” symbol. 
The ad-hoc marker MAY be used in combination with any of the other markers. 
The marker for a Sub-Process that is used for compensation MUST be a pair of left facing triangles (like a tape player “rewind” button). 
 The Compensation marker MAY be used in combination with any of the other markers. 
All the markers that are present MUST be grouped and the whole group centered at the bottom of the Sub-Process.

Note:
-----
This info text and the info texts of the attributes contained in this class are mainly taken from the official "Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) Version 2.0" specification.

The BPMN 2.0 specification may be downloaded from the Object Management Group (OMG) website http://www.omg.org/spec/BPMN/2.0/
